revised_title: Observation and Calculation of the Summer Solstice in 1812 at the Royal Observatory
tldr: The author, John Pond, describes his observations of the summer solstice in 1812 at the Royal Observatory using the newly erected mural circle. He discusses the method of determining the north polar distance of the sun and the importance of the zenith point in the calculations. Additionally, Pond mentions the ongoing development of a zenith sector by Mr. Troughton, which may provide a more precise determination of the distance between the zenith and the pole.
